definition: Ying, ancient capital of Chu 楚 in Hubei, Jianling county 江陵縣|江陵县
to present to a superior/memorial/petition/to present (a certain appearance)/to assume (a shape)/to be (a certain color)

lit. Ying writes a letter and Yan reads it/fig. to misinterpret the original meaning/to pile up errors/refers to the letter from capital 郢[Ying3] of 楚[Chu3] in which the inadvertent words "hold up the candle" are mistaken by the minister of 燕[Yan1] as "promote the wise"

sentences.english: The successful experience of coal mine technology reform is introduced.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了毛郢孜煤矿进行矿井技术改造的成功经验。

sentences.english: Chapter One is mainly found on Ying Capital's location and age to the study.
sentences.chinese: 第一章主要是关于郢都建都地望及年代的研究。

sentences.english: The Ying man hadn't showed any fear on his face, not even blinkered his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 郢人不仅脸上未变，连眼睛都没有眨一下。

sentences.english: In ancient times, a personal letter from Chu Ying Yan to the country.
sentences.chinese: 古时候，有个人从楚国的郢都写信给燕国的相国。

definition: chaste tree or berry (Vitex agnus-castus)/alternative name for the Zhou Dynasty state of Chu 楚國|楚国[Chu3 guo2]
a thorny tree/sugarcane/Cudrania triloba/three-bristle cudrania (Cudrania tricuspidata)/Chinese mulberry (Cudrania)
surname Ying/river in Henan and Anhui
grain husk/tip of sth short and slender
surname Ye/ancient district in modern day Hebei Province 河北省[He2 bei3 Sheng3]

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)/surname Yan
